intro: Koernickea lanata, commonly known as the woolly koernickea, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant is distinguished by its hairy, glandular stems and leaves, which give it a distinctive, fuzzy appearance. It produces small yellow flowers that are clustered in dense, spherical heads. Koernickea lanata typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments.
